newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: FORECAST - FCL Energy profit seen down.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - FCL Energy profit seen down.

text.p: Fletcher Energy is expected to report a decline in annual profit before abnormal items, largely due to the operation its Maui B platform, analysts said on Friday.
Energy made a NZ$32 million profit on the sale of its interest in Bay of Plenty Electricity, but the sale happened after balance data and was unlikely to be included.
Analysts expect a net profit of around NZ$45-6 million, down from $64 million last June year.
Maui B was likely to cause an increase in depreciation and amortisation charges, but cash flows were expected to be strong.
Oil prices did not have much of an impact, although they were bettter in U.S. dollar terms.
Doyle Paterson Brown analyst David Stanley is forecasting a profit of NZ$46 million before abnormals.

Paul Richardson, energy analyst at SBC Warburg, said earnings before interest before tax would be around NZ$120 million, but the underlying profit was going to be lower than last year's. He expects a fall to around NZ$50 million.
"Basically they will probably spend a bit more on exploration or account for it in that (second) half, offsetting whatever they've got out of better oil prices as well," he said.
He expects exploration expendutire to be higher, up at around NZ$70 million.
The focus now would be on new projects. Analysts would be keen to see progress on the Brunei field and the drilling timetable for New Zealand.
There may be further utility divestments further down the track after the exit from Bay of Plenty Electricity.
Energy owns one third of utility Natural Gas Corp. The Australian Gas Light Co also owns a third and the public own the rest.
But Natural Gas was a strong performer and Energy was not likely to be in any rush to sell, analysts said.
